title: readme: fix several typos
body:
Closes #3 

This PR fixes README.md, some spelling errors like:

* In the `IMPORTANT` section, change **pratical** to **practical**.
* In the `Why ASPL?` section, consider changing **Builtin** to **Built-in** under the `Huge standard library` point.
* In the `Random number` example, change **into the console** to **to the console** for consistency.
* In the final NOTE section, the link uses:
   ```html
    <a hreF="...">
   ```
    Change **hreF** to **href** for proper link syntax.
    
Kindly, review my PR.

title: installer: refactor & improve the Bash-based installer script
body:
Hej, I wanted to improve a bit (pimp) install script for linux with a few features:
- download latest SHA and ASSET_ID's silently
- download executable and template with progress bar
- ask user if to create a symlink
- add sudo to symlink creation (on my system it was required to access /usr/local/bin)
- unpack and override only newer files for templates.zip
author: Krotki

comments.body:
Thank you for this PR (the very first one for ASPL actually ðŸ˜„)!

As you already mentioned on Discord, `install.bat` should obviously not be deleted, please try to restore it.

Why is the `IFS=''` in line 3 needed? I'm not very familiar with bash, but from a quick search, I don't see why we need it.

Also, I think it should be made a little clearer what a symlink is/why one might want it in the prompt you've added; some less experienced programmers might not know what it does. What do you think?

Besides that, your improved installer script looks good to me, thank you again!
(I've just changed your title so it matches the commit message norm in this repository.)

As for IFS I was experimenting with read command and delimiters, but it is completely unnecessary here. Removed.

I also rephrased the question. Is it cleaner ?
I'd probably phrase it something like ```Make the `aspl` command available everywhere (by creating a symlink in /usr/local/bin)?```

And by the way, I'm currently thinking about removing `install_ci.sh` because the CI/CD workflow can basically use the regular installer script nowadays. If we did this, we wouldn't have to update that script as well. Just so you know, I might not instantly merge your PR.

> I'd probably phrase it something like Make the `aspl` command available everywhere (by creating a symlink in /usr/local/bin)?

So, what do you think? Shall we change it, or do you think people will understand the prompt even when they're not very familiar with shells and file systems?

I can merge the PR after we've settled on a wording.
